111.content: Which one do you want?
111.title: Mythological

choices: A small anthro dragon with blue scales
A small anthro dragon with black scales
A small anthro dragon with green scales
1111.content:
The sun begins to set along the hillside. A small village sets on the base of a mountain. Most of the homes are small huts made of wood and some of them are made of clay topped with hay roofs. A few farm houses are set on the hills over the east and the south. A large pond is off to the north, and the sea is way off to the west. The village lights the torches through the streets, illuminating the entire village. Kids began to play around, and some of the adults were walking about. A large, muscular man dressed in tan animal hide outfit was wondering the streets. He had blue eyes, brown hair, and had a bushy beard. Walking beside this tough man, was probably the most beautiful woman in the whole village. She had long blone hair, green eyes, and tan skin. She wore a nice red dress made of wool. She had a slender body, but her belly was extended.. The two were holding hands as they walked down the streets. They looked at each other and smiled.

"I can't believe that our child is almost here" said the woman.

"I cannot either dear" said the man. "I know it will be rough to raise a family, but we can manage."

"Yes we can Zaggar."

Suddenly, the woman stopped walking and held her stomach. She nearly fell over, but Zaggar prevented her.

"Jade!" he said. "Are you okay?"

"...Z-Zaggar..." she said. "T-The...b-baby..."

Zaggar grabbed his wife and carried her to a larger hut. The woman inside immediately knew what was happening, and helped the woman to a bed. Outside, a shadowy figure was looking through a window. Its eyes were red, and its teeth were white.

"Stupid mortals" it said. Its voice was deep and sinister. "Those humans don't know the true meaning of life. Especially that hunter. Killing monsters like they were simple houseflys. That man needs to be taught a lesson on the true meaning of a life."

The dark figure waved its hands around, and a faint red light followed. The shadow laughed before he left.

"That will definitely teach them a lesson."

Jade is sitting in the bed, looking exhausted. She looked up at Zaggar and smiled.

"We did it honey" she said.

"Yes we did" said Zaggar.

The baby was wrapped in a light blue blanket. Jade slowly removed the blankets, but she looked back in horror. Zaggar looked surprised as well. Under the covers, was...
1111.title: The Beginning

choices: Take care of it, its your child
11112.content:
Underneath the blanket, was a small dragon. It had black scales, that covered its entire body. Further removing the blanket, revealed that it was a dragon with a human body. Its underbelly was a lighter shade of black. It had small growths on its back that would eventually grow into wings. It had a tail with a larger scale on the end of it. It had a small muzzle, and small, rounded horns on its head. Its small hands and feet had small black claws. It tugged at the blanket to cover itself up. Jade and Zaggar looked at each other in surprise.

"Zaggar...how...?" asked Jade.

"I do not know" replied Zaggar. "But, what do we do? I feel a little uncomfortable having a child that looks like a beast that I onced killed."

Jade brought the young dragon closer to her. "I am not letting you kill our child!"

"I would never do that. But, what are we going to do? I mean, its not like we can take care of this thing without getting some attention."

Jade looked sad and looked back down at their creation. "I guess you are right. But, what will we do?"
11112.title: Dragon Child

111121.content:
Jade is surprised of Zagger's answer, "Are you sure Zagger, what if something happens to us or the child?"

"I'll take that chance" said Zagger, "I might as well accept this as my punishment"

"You Punishment?" questioned Jade, "But this is our child, our gift"

"I know that" said Zagger, "We will both take good care of this child"

Both agreed to keep it, even though there is a huge risk and it is not entirely human. They just did not have the heart to give away the child since they both aways wanted one. And maybe with time, the people of the village, the royal family and eventually the rest of the world could accept this child. Also maybe it could be a way to make peace with the dragons and other creatures.

But let's not get too ahead of ourselves. What is the gender of their anthro dragon child?
111121.title: Keep this child

choices: Skip ahead a few years or so
The creature who caused this appears
1111211.content:
"Mother! Father!" The little black dragon boy came running to his parents, tears in his eyes and a bruise on the side of his head and arm. "Zan! What happened to you?" His mother held him tightly in her arms. "T-the other children! T-they...They threw rocks at me! I was, *sob* I was out in the woods, looking at the trees! They saw me and called me a monster!" Zan's mother led him back inside their hut. Jade mended his wounds while Zaggar, his father, tried to console his son. "Now son, we've already told you that you shouldn't be outside during the day! You can go outside as much as you want at night." "But, *sob* the woods look better during the day, and it's too scary to go there at night!" "I know son, but I fear for what the other villagers might do to you if they see you. So please, don't go out during the day, alright?" "...Okay..."

It has been a few years ever since his birth, and Zan has grown to a healthy boy ever since. But he was always kept inside the hut, and he longed for the freedom to venture out into the world. His parents would always tell him that he should never let the others see him, and he usually obeyed them. But sometimes, he would go sneak a peek at the woods in broad daylight every once in a while. Apparently, today was his unlucky day.

"Mother, father, why am I so different from everyone? I don't even look like you two." His parents casted concerned glances to each other. There was a silence until Jade spoke. "Because Zan, you are special. And I just know that you will live a life that will go down in history. Now you should get some rest now, okay?" "Okay!" Zan, instantly filled with happiness at his mother's words, climbed into his bed and dozed off to sleep.

111121111.content:
Zan sat on a clif whachting the sun rise. He soon had to go inside, but he allways like to whacht the sun-rise.
His wing just grown fully in the past year, and so did his lonelyness. He longed for at least one freind.
"What happen to me, my mother and father are humans" but his tought was interruped by the sun getting in his eyes.
"Better go inside" Zan said sighing. He was makeing his way down, when a rock sliped out from his foot and he tumbled down the clif.
Luckly he grabed onto a tree, that had grown off the side of the clif.
He looked around, the only way down is to let go. The side of the clif was too steep.
But then the tree started to fall over. He looked for something to grab onto.
There was nothing he could do, he fell down the rest of the way.
He landed on one of his wings and broke it. Zan looked down at his leg and saw the bone sticking out.
The spot where the bone was pokeing ouy, was bleeding bad. It was a long walk back to the shack.
111121111.title: Choice 1

1111211112.content:
Elesa was walking along the forest path just as the sun began to rise. She always enjoyed walking through the forest at that time. She had long golden hair and blue eyes. She left in her white night gown that stopped right above her small feet. Her skin was a deep tan from being outside for a while. At age 14, she was a blessed angel. She was carrying a bag with supplies just invade she got into any mishaps. While walking, Elesa heard a bracket snap and saw a black figure tumble down the cliff. She ran near the spot and ducked behind the bushes. When Elesa peered put, she gasped in awe. In front of her seemed to be like a human mixed with a dragon. It also seemed like a male. He had black scales that made him barely visible to the given amount of light. Two grand wings spread across him as well as a tail. Elesa stared in awe, but noticed something. One of his wings seemed to be snapped back and a bone was out of his leg. The strange creature was wincing in pain. Elesa was slightly scared, but she need to help. She even had supplies to help! She stood up and walked out from the bushes.

---

Zan was trying to ease the pain of his wing and leg so he could get home. He knew he would be in big trouble when he got home. Then, he heard the bushes beside them rustle. Zan turned his head to find one of the most beautiful girls he has ever seen. Her long golden hair seemed to glow in the soon to be gone darkness. Her blue eyes glistened like the water of a pond at sunset. Her skin was a wondrous tan that very few people could obtain. She was walking closer to Zan. But, he moved back. If that girl was seen with him she would get hurt by some of the other teens. however, she kept approaching.

"Please....let me help you..." she said.

Her voice was like a harp playing and a angel singing in perfect harmony. Zan was soothed by her speech, but still moved back. His wing and leg were feeling worse and worse everytime. Eventually, the girl approached Zan too quickly for him and she pulled out something from her bag. Zan was scared; most people tried to kill him before with a hidden dagger. But instead of feeling the cold of the dagger, he felt a warm and gentle touch. Zan opened his eyes and saw the girl tending to his broken wing. She was spreading this substance over it that stung at first, but made the pain quickly vanish. Afterwards she tied some bandages over it to keep it from moving much. The girl did the same to Zan's leg but she had to force the bone back in. It hurt Zan greatly but he tried not to move much. After she was finished, Zan began to stand up; keeping his leg stiff.

---

Elesa couldn't believe how tall the creature really was. The boy was nearly two feet taller than her! The creature began to turn to leave, but he fell to one knee after only taking a step. Elesa ran next to him but he pushed her away.

"Just go where you came from..." he said in a deep voice. "I don't want you to get Hirt, so you can't be seen with me..."

Elesa was surprised that the boy could speak. Now that she was relatively closer Elesa could see the well toned muscles in his arms, legs, and chest. He almost had a six pack. She could see it in his eyes that he was concerned for her well-being. The boy tried to take another step but the same result happened. Only this time, Elesa went under his arm to try and stop the impact. It was hard for her, but she wanted to help.

---

Zan was surprised by this human girl's actions. No one has ever treated him like this except for his parents. The girl was struggling to keep him off his leg. He felt like pushing her away again, but that might drive her away...
1111211112.title: A Encounter Like No Other

Maybe she would help him get back to the shack. He slow sat back down and flinch at the pain.
Zan looked at the girl and said “I need you to help me back to my home”
Elesa put her hand and the scaly shoulder. “I will….what’s your name?”

Zan was shocked that this girl asked him his name. He sat that in clear shock, he was too lost to answer.

Eleas figer if he told her his name she could trust him with hers “Mine is Eleas, where do you live?”
Zan looked around and then said “I have been living at the edge of town, nobody know that here”.
A bird that flown out of a tree stop Zan but he started back “I need you to not talk about me”
“Why not?” Eleas said, she didn’t know that he lived at the edge of her town.
“Because…if…...people would know about me….many bad thing…would happen” Zan said softly.
Because what he said he remember many encounters that ended up in hurt felling.
The events happen rarely, but they hurt him badly.

“How old are you Zan?” Eleas asked. She could tell something was bothering him.
So she tried to get his mind off of what ever it was.
“14” Zan said looking back at Eleas “I need to get back home by the time the sun is fully up”
Elesa gasped because she saw that the sun was half way up the mountain line.

Elesa help Zan walk the trip back to his home. She had his arm around her neck and Zan was hoping on his good leg.

They talked as they walked, Eleas told Zan about her self.
She lived with only her mother, her father was off fighting as a knight.
Zan told some things about him, he didn’t want to give away every thing. He trusted her, he but was still funny. Then they came to the shack.
“Ok I can get the rest of the way, remember to not tell about me” Zan said. “Don’t worry I will” Eleas said.
11112111122.title: Let her Help

111121111221.content:
When Zan opened the door his father grab him and pulled him in.
“What are you doing, the sun is now fully out” Zagger said.
But when he saw the bandages he yelled out “What happen?!?!”
Zan put up his hand and said “Hold on, I can tell you what happened”
“When I was walking down a cliff face a rock slipped from my foot and I fell down”.
Zan straighten him self up “Luckily I grabbed onto a tree, but it the tree broke from the cliff and I went the rest of the way, my wing and leg broke when I fell down the rest of the way”

choices: There's a knock on the door, it's Elesa
Move on a couple of months
1111211112211.content:
Zan sighed, "No mother, father is right. I should explain."

The room became awkwardly quiet after Zan spoke that. Zaggar and Jade sat down and waited patiently. "After I fell from the cliff and broke my leg and wing, I thought I was going to die. But then, a human girl came to me."

"Someone saw you?!" exclaimed Zaggar.

Zan nodded, "I was as surprised as you are father. She didn't run from me or try to hurt me. She had this strange look in her eyes that made her seem like she was excited to see me. Anyway, the girl was named Elesa. She helped bandage my injuries and helped me back here. Before she left, Elesa promised she wouldn't tell anyone about me."

"And you're going to take her word for it?" asked Zaggar.

"Yes father, I trust her. She won my trust, no one could be that pretty and nice and not be trustworthy."

The room fell silent again. Each member of the household had a different expression on their face. Zaggar was shocked that someone has seen his son. He wants to make sure that he is safe as well as him and his wife. Zan had the mixed emotions of depression and confusion. He was sad that he went against his father's orders and confused because of him telling his story being a good thing. Jade, however, was the only person with a smile. She was glad to hear someone helping her son for a change. But that's not all. She also detected a small feeling of love in Zan's words. It wasn't that surprising, she and Zaggar kept Zan contained for years and Zan knew nothing about communication.
1111211112211.title: The Truth

4 months passed and Zan's leg and wing was healed up completly. Zan han't seen Elesa in the 4 months ether.

It was dead in the middle of the night, Zan was out in a claering with his wings spread out.
Zan now takes sometime to strech out his wings. He was thankfull that the fall didn't hurt his wings so bad it would had been useless.
He known that he could fly if he just tried, then he heard someone walking behind him.
Zan truned around to see Elesa, "Zan it is you!!!" Elesa said running up to him.

"It's been too long Zan, I see that you are doing better" Elesa said hugging him.
"Ya..a, lot....better...than last...time" Zan was strugging to say. Elesa sat down and Zan did too.
"What was you doing when I walked up?" asked Elesa. "I am more gratefull now about the fact I do have wings, and I fell like useing them more" Zan said.
A smile apear on Elesa face, "Oh ya, I found something you might like, it's in my bag let me dig around for it" she said digging into her bag.
11112111122112.title: Meet Agean.

111121111221122.content:
Elesa was still digging through her bag. But, she stopped and pulled the item out. It was a black gemstone tied to a string by a silver latch. Zan's eyes went wide as Elesa unlatched it and placed it around Zan's neck. Elesa pulled out another necklace, but this one was white. She placed it around her neck.

"Elesa...this is amazing..." said Zan.

"I knew you would like it" she replied. "I have one too, so that way we can tell who we are if we don't see each other again. Promise me you will never take it off..."

Elesa had her hand on Zan's muscular chest. Zan placed his clawed hand over hers, "I promise..." Elesa smiled and embraced Zan in a hug. Zan smiled along with her. Elesa has done a lot for him. He wanted to do something for her. His face then flashed with an idea. He got up, getting out of the loving embrace that Elesa had on him.

"What's wrong Zan?" Elesa asked while looking at the horizon. "The sun is not up yet."

"I know Elesa, but I had an idea" he replied.

"An idea of what?"

Zan's wings extended to their fullest length. His wingspan was nearly fifteen feet across. "An idea how to repay you for your kindness. Grab onto my back..." Elesa walked over and wrapped her arms around Zan's thick neck. Elesa still couldn't believe how much muscle Zan had. Even though he was part dragon, most human males would die for this much muscle. She couldn't help but to blush at the sheer toughness of his muscles. Zan began to walk towards the edge of the cliff. He flexed his wings and jumped. Elesa was surprised by this. Zan never flies before so she closed her eyes and held on tightly. Zan, on the other hand, knew how to. It came to him as soon as he jumped. It was almost like an instinct. He beat his wings and flew successfully. He waited till he was above the cloud layer to tell Elesa.

"Elesa, open your eyes" said Zan.

Elesa was hesitant, but her eyelids slowly opened. She gasped at the sight below her. The full moon was illuminating the ground beneath them. The small villages were now tiny clusters of light. The distant lake shimmered in the moon's light. Elesa was happy, happier than she has ever been in her whole life. Zan was content as well. He has never felt this experience; both flying and being around other people. After what seemed to be hours, Zan landed back on the cliff he took off of. But his landing wasn't perfect so Zan and Elesa tumbled a short distance on the top laughing. Elesa landed on top of Zan's chest. She blushed again as she could feel the strong muscles beneath his thick hide. Zan sat up and looked into Elesa's eyes. Her eyes were full of happiness, but they seemed to be filled with something much more. Their faces got closer and closer...
111121111221122.title: Giving a Gift for a Gift

choices: They go to the next level(please be non descriptive)
1111211112211221.content:
Zan's and Elesa's lips met and they kissed. Zan was surprised but he never showed it. A kiss was something he has never experienced before. Elesa, on the otherhand, was enjoying it even more than Zan. None of the guys at her village would ever treat her like Zan does. He was so kind and always put her safety ahead of her's. All of the other men would always talk to her just to try and see more of her beauty that she shows already (you get what I'm saying right?) Another thing Elesa loved about Zan was his body. Sure, she wasn't those girls that only go with a guy for looks, but Zan was a double deal. Zan had looks and a personality to match. The kiss was finally broken after what seemed like an eternity. Both Zan and Elesa stared at each other with great compassion.

"You're the greatest Zan..." said Elesa while she hugged his massive chest.

Zan returned the hug, but his tail and wings followed. Elesa was covered with nearly every scale on Zan. They kissed once again and kept each other in a loving embrace. Both of their love for each other was so great, it was beyond comprehension. Nothing could ever separate them. They broke the kiss one last time and they both said, "I love you." They kissed again and this one seemed it would never end.
1111211112211221.title: True Love's First Kiss

11112111122112211.content:
Zan couldn't believe his luck. To think, just yesterday he had kissed someone. Not just anyone, but his friend; the implications were considerable.

Naturally, new thoughts began to emerge- what if he were to take this further? What would his family think? Would Elesa think this was a good idea? Perhaps it would be wise to take this slowly...
11112111122112211.title: One day at a time.

Changed into a full dragon(I know there's a rule but I meant to change it.)
1111211112211222.content:
"Well well well...what do we have here?" said a voice.

Both Elesa and Zan turned to see who spoke. A cloaked man was standing on the cliff with him. His robe was blood red as well as his eyes. Zan immediately received a threat sense from this guy and stood up. He spread his wings to protect Elesa and stood in a battle ready stance. The man chuckled as he began to slowly walk around Zan. "Now now...is that any way to treat someone...?"

Zan grunted as he followed the man, making sure he was in between the man and Elesa. "You seem like a threat" he said. "I can sense something wrong with you."

"I expected as much, I have that effect on mortals. But why are you treating ME like this? After all that I've given you..."

"What in the world did you ever give me?!"

"Look at yourself; the scales, the wings, the claws, the muscular tone, I made you what you are!" Both Zan and Elesa were surprised to hear him say this. The man chuckled at their reaction. "I might as well start from the beginning. Your parents were just about to have you. Your mother was a kind woman, but your father wasn't. Your father was a monster slayer! He slaughtered thousands of my beautiful creations just to make a quick payment. So, I decided to pay a visit to the young famy. I cursed their child to be half dragon, hoping they would suffer and get rid of you. But no!" The man seemed to be in pain, "Those two humans decided to keep their offspring, despite what you looked like! I had so many plans for you! I was going to give your father a visit with you, so that you could kill him for me!" Then the man began to moan in pleasure, "Oh! The sweet image of that wretched man's mauled corpse with his blood dripping everywhere...that's my dream..."

Zan could not take it anymore. He lunged at the man and pinned him down. He bared his teeth and growled at the man. "You better not lay a single finger on my father!" Zan placed his teeth as close as he could to the man. The man simply laughed, "Oh, don't worry, I won't do anything..." A sudden surge of energy burst from the man's loose hand and launched Zan into a tree, "But nothing said anything about you!" the man disappeared into a shadow as he laughed. Elesa ignored the man and ran to Zan. Red energy began to absorb into his body and Zan uttered a low growl.

"Zan...?" she asked.

Suddenly Zan stood to his feet and let a loud roar of pain out. He began to grab his head as he thrashed about. Elesa tried to approach him, "No Elesa stay back!" Elesa stopped and watched in horror as Zan...
1111211112211222.title: The Cause Returns

choices: Zan regans some control he finds out he was going to kill Elesa when he came to
11112111122112221.content:
From the shadows the man waved his hand in some red energy.

"I have power over your mind now, I will give you more power and then make your own father kill you, that shall bring him down so I can kill him slowly"

He put his other hand under the waveying and and dark energy started to mix in with the red energy.

"I will win in the end!!!"

-----

Zan could see and feel the red energy in his eyes and all over his body. Slowly everything became black, and Zan fell down. Elesa slowly walked over to Zan Suddenly, his body was covered in dark energy. Slowly he became more taller and more muscular. Elesa was about to put her hand on Zan.

When he slamed his hand on the ground, Elesa jumped back at the sudden movement. The ground beneath his hand was now cracked. She could see Zan getting up and looking around. "Zan?" He truned to her and looked at her with red covered eyes.

"What? What is he doing, dose he have controll over me?" Zan tought as he tried to open his eyes.

Zan tried to regain some control, he could see a vison slowly becoming clear.
11112111122112221.title: Mind Control

choices: Ran away from Elesa, fearing for her survival
Attacks the man in blind fury(intro to fire breath)
111121111221122212.content:
The vision came clear, but something changed in his mind. His feelings for Elesa disappeared and was filled with anger and bloodlust. He cared nothing for humans anymore, they were just a minor annoyance in front of his master's way. Kill her slave... Zan moved slowly at first. He wanted to scare his prey first.

---

Elesa couldn't believe what she saw. Zan had transformed from her crush to a monster. Zan grew to nearly nine feet tall. His muscles expanded greatly. Although Elesa was fond of Zan's muscles before, these now scared her. His clawed hands once nearly one inch long claws. But now, these claws lengthened to what seemed like eight inches. The horns on his head appeared harder and longer while new ones grew along his spine. His tail was now accompanied with long spikes. But his eyes, his eyes were the most evil of anything. His eyes were blood red with a very thin slit as the pupil. These eyes gleamed at her to the highest level of hatred Elesa has ever seen. What was worse was that growls were escaping through his mouth. Zan was walking slowly towards Elesa, never leaving his stare. Before Elesa could make an attempt to say something, Zan pounced on her with a feral roar. He swung his claws at her wildly, severly tearing the skin on her arm. Elesa managed to escape from under Zan and headed towards the hillside of the cliff. Blood was running down her arm. Elesa needed to get away. Zan though, was not going let her leave. He launched off the ground with one flap of his larger wings. He landed right in front of her and took out her legs with his tail. Not only did she fall, but the spikes also left a large gash in Elesa's leg. Elesa was now on the ground in pain. Blood was flowing out of her with no sign of stopping. Her right arm and both legs were nearly useless. Elesa could only watch as Zan moved closer and closer. He licked his lips and smiled, his new sharper teeth revealing themselves. Elesa made on final attempt to try to get to him.

"Zan...please...you can fight this" she said. "Zan...look at yourself. People have called you a monster for years, and you never showed anyone that it is true. But now, your what everyone called you; a monster. Please Zan...fight this..."

---

The girl's plea was meaningless. Zan didnt even remember who she was. But, something glittered in his eyes. It was a small necklace around the girl's neck. A memory hit him. Elesa. Their encounter. Their flight. Zan realized who she was and looked. Her arm and both legs had a wide gash in it. Blood was spilling out everywhere. Elesa had an expression of fear, but it was the strongest expression he had ever seen before. He looked down at his claws and trembled. Blood. Elesa's blood. It was covering his hands. Tears began to form in Zan's eyes. Zan...
111121111221122212.title: Attacking the one you love

1111211112211222122.content:
"She means nothing to you" the man's voice yelled into Zan's head. Zan cluchted his hands togater.

"You are wrong.....she is EVERY THING TO ME!!!! Zan roared truning around and focsed on the tree line. "You dare fight me? How can you fight me? I have control over your body!" the man voice said to Zan.

"Becuse I can!!" Zan yelled running at the tree line.

"You are stupid like your father" The man yelled.

He busted forth from the tree line, Zan tried to swing at the man. But he moved out of the way and pulled out a rod. "I guess I will have to take your soul and turn your body into a doll that I can use" the man grined at what he said. He went to jab the rod into Zan, but the rod was cut in half. "You fucker" the man yelled in rage. He jumped back and landed a good ways away. The man opened his palm. Ever so slowly, a red and black ball of energy began to grow and spin faster as the seconds past. "I guess I will have to kill you..."

Zan growled at the man, he was about to run when suddenly he felt his body siffen up. "What is going on, why can't I move" Zan yelled in his head.

"Becuse I have you in my spell and till I die, you won't be free" the man said. Then some one grabed the man by the back of the neck. "Then how about I kill you" Zagger said boldly. Unseathing his claymore, he thrusted the blade into his back and through the man's heart. "ugg....fuck....you are going to hell like me, see you there mother-fucker" the man said in pain. Zagger twisted the blade, and pulled it out roughly. The man fell on his knees dead. Red energy began to flow from Zan back to the man. The spell that controlled Zan's body was leaving.

"I will be back" the man softly said falling to the ground.
1111211112211222122.title: The Battle...

choices: Elesa wakes up and forgives him
11112111122112221221.content:
As the man's evil magic left Zan's body, all of the demonic features about him left. However, he did keep some of his new height and muscle. Zan was glad he could move again. But Elesa entered his mind again. He ran to her and gently propped her up with his arms. "Elesa...? Elesa! Please wake up!" No response. Elesa just lied there silent as death. Zaggar walked near them and began to tie bandages around Elesa's wounds. "Your lucky" he said, "She's still living, but she has lost a lot of blood. I'm not sure when she'll wake up, but she will live." Zan sighed with relief as he stood up to carry her. Zan walked instead of flying. He didn't want to hurt Elesa even more and he didn't want his father to know. After Zan entered his hut and placed Elesa on his bed, he was greeted by a loving embrace from his mother. She seemed smaller to him, he was sure of it. But Zan was worried more about Elesa. His mother did everything she could about her wounds. Zaggar and Zan never explained to Jade what caused the injuries. After she was done, Zan entered the room. Elesa had several bandages covering her right arm and legs. She was still unconscious, but she had a stunned expression of fear. This nearly made Zan cry. He kneeled beside her and brushed the hair away from her beautiful face.

"Elesa...I'm so sorry..." he said. "I can't believe I hurt you. I wasn't myself, I was being controlled by that man. I would never hurt you. I wouldn't let anything hurt you. I...I....I love you..." Tears were now streaming down Zan's eyes. "You were the first human besides my parents to show any affection to me. You helped me despite the danger you put yourself in. You have a kind heart and beauty to match. Please....Elesa...please forgive me..."
11112111122112221221.title: Apology

choices: "I want you to meet my parents..."
"What will my parents say if I cone home with these bandages...?"
111121111221122212211.content:
A small groan and a gasp of air escaped from Elesa's mouth. Zan uncovered his eyes and looked at Elesa. He was hoping that the slightest spark of life was in her, and his wish came true. Elesa's slowly opened, revealing the beautiful but drowsy blue hue. She slowly sat up and looked at Zan. He was kneeling, his arms out to help prop her up, and rivers of tears falling from his eyes. "Elesa I...." Zan tried to speak but Elesa stopped him. Tears were beginning to fall from her eyes. "Zan...you don't have to speak" she said. "I heard every word you said. I...I love you too..." With that said, Elesa's lips met Zan's. At first, Zan was shocked. But he felt the warmth from her lips and continued. After a minute they broke the kiss. Zan was still shocked, his blacks scales seem to take on a red blush. Elesa giggled at his reaction.

"You never have been kissed before have you?" she asked.

"I have never been kissed like that before" he replied. "I've also never been kissed by someone as beautiful as you..."

This caused Elesa's cheeks to flush red. They were about to kiss again until Jade opened the door and entered the room. She was surprised for a second but then a smile came onto her face. "I knew this would happen" she said. She walked in with a glass of water and handed it to Elesa. "When you came back with those bandages and mentioned her, I knew you were in love."

"I'm sorry, but who are you?" asked Elesa.

"I am Jade, Zan's mother."

Elesa seemed shocked but kept quiet. She would let Jade continue. "Zan, at your age, staying isolated can be hard. I knew you would find something to leave here. But I'm glad it wasn't for anything violent. I'm also glad you found someone like Elesa."

"Your not going to tell dad are you?" he asked.

"Tell me what son?" said Zaggar. Everyone turned to see him standing in the entrance. "Tell me that you fell in love with this girl? Zan, I knew from your very birth that there would be a difficulty trying to find someone like you. Your mother and I have already discussed this. I will allow you to see Elesa."

Zan and Elesa smiled and embraced each other in a tight hug. Elesa however quickly released her loving embrace. "Zan..." she started to say.
111121111221122212211.title: True Love

choices: The next day the meeting turns out good
The next day the meeting doesn't turn out so good...
1111211112211222122111.content:
Zan sighed, he know he would have to meet them sooner or later. "I just hope that things won't get out of hand" Zan said.

"I am sure that they will understand, they do believe evil beings are out there. But they leave that stuff alone" Elesa said.

"Well then how about you two go before the sun rises up. That's still a little ways away, so I would rest if I was you. It would be better for you when you get up" Zagger said walking out of the room. "He's right, rest up you two" Jade said walking out of the room. She smiled as she slowly closed the door behind her.

--------

"Jade do you think things will turn out good when Zan meets Elesa's parents?" Zagger asked when they was out of ear shot.

"I think it will turn out good. Yes, why? You don't think so?" Jade said.

"No, I do think so, I just wanted to know what you was thinking about his whole thing" Zagger said.

"Zagger this is for the better, he needs someone like Elesa in his life" Jade said. Zagger sighed and said "You are right Jade."

"Aren't I always...?"

With that said, Jade gave Zaggar a kiss on his cheek and they went to their bedroom.
1111211112211222122111.title: How Will This Go.....

choices: Her mother likes him, her father hates him
Her mother hates him, her father likes him
11112111122112221221111.content:
Jade told Elesa and Zan to rest up. But Zan never fell asleep. He wasn't tired at all. He stayed up guarding Elesa. The man said that he would be back, and Zan did not want him to take control again. However Zan thought a little sleep wouldnt hurt so he climbed into the bed next to Elesa. Elesa rolled over in her sleep and wrapped her arms around Zan's chest. The sun wasn't going to rise soon, so Zan and Elesa had some time. Elesa woke up still around Zan. His wings draped over them fully extended. She smiled and kissed Zan's cheek. Zan smiled and slowly opened his eyes. Zan tried to get up but Elesa kept her hands close to Zan's chest. "I've never had such a great sleep" she told him. "Your scales are so warm. I hope my parents like you as much as I do..."

Zan smiled and laid there a bit longer. Eventually the pair got out of the bed. Zan had a quick snack before his parents told him good luck. Elesa was able take off the bandages off of her legs but her wound on her arm was greater. Zan became depressed at this but Elesa kissed Zan on his cheek and said she would make an excuse. A few minutes away from his house, Zan extended his wings and Elesa wrapped her arms around him. Elesa's house was closer to the village than Zan's, but not many people passed by their home. The couple got there in no time. The house was a average sized farm house. Zan stepped to the side of the door as Elesa entered. Immediately, Zan heard her parents greet her. He couldn't hear that well because they went to a different room.

---

Elesa was quickly rushed by her parents. Her father was an average sized man with brown hair and brown eyes. Her mother looked nearly identical to Elesa.

"Elesa dear your back!" said her mother. "We were so worried about you!"

"Elesa...how did you get those bandages?" asked her father.

"That's kinda what I want to tell you" she said. "I'll explain everything."

"But first" said her mother, "How did your evening with your admirer go?"

Elesa blushed and both of her parents knew the answer immediately. Elesa waited for her parents to sit down. "After I gave him the necklace, he showed me an experience I will never forget...He's just so handsome and strong...He even saved my life." This made Elesa's parents gasp. "We were resting on the cliff and I nearly fell off. But sadly on the way down my arm met a sharp rock. That's why I have these bandages. Anyway, I invited him over but there's something I need to tell you first. Zan is...different..."

"Different how sweetie?" asked her mother.

"I believe it's better for me to show you rather than explain."

Elesa ran to the door and opened it.

----

Zan saw Elesa pop her head out and he followed. He accidentally hit his head on the door frame, causing a giggle from Elesa. Zan was slightly too tall for the doorway and his wings would cause a mess. Elesa noticed this and called her parents over. They stepped into view but quickly became filled with fear.

"It's okay...I'm not here to hurt you" said Zan. "I just wanted you to meet me. It's true that I saved your daughter's life, but she also helped mine. I fell from the same cliff and damaged my wing and leg. She helped after everything I told her to stay away. I'm happy that I met your daughter. But if you have a problem with me, I will leave."

All three seemed surprised that he said that. Elesa wanted nothing more than for Zan to be with her. However her parents...
11112111122112221221111.title: One Understands, Another Doesn't

111121111221122212211111.content:
Both of the adults in the room were utterly shocked. Their daughter fell in love and brought home a monster. Trey, Elesa's father, quickly grabbed his daughter and pulled her close. "Get back you beast!" he shouted in anger. Zan could not say he expected as much. His wings drooped in sadness as he turned for the door. Janet, Elesa's mother, saw something different. She saw that Zan was a dragon, but behind that scaly hide was the heart and soul of a gentleman. He arrived in a calm fashion, properly addressed himself, and even told then he would leave if he was a problem. There was no monster here.

The woman quickly approached Zan just before he left. "Zan, why not stay a bit?" she asked. "It's bright outside, you would have difficulties going home." Before her husband or Zan could protest, Janet grasped his arm and pulled him inside. Elesa fought against her father's grasp and ran to her lover's side. Zan smiled, at least one parent understood.

Trey was both shocked and infuriated. That beast belongs in the woods, if not that then dead. However he knew that going against his wife and daughter would be trouble. He just let them lead that...freak inside.

Zan was lead to the main area, the family room. A simple arrangement of furniture. However the house seemed what most higher officials had. The only thing Zan has ever known was his parent's shack. Janet asked Zan if he was hungry, but the anthro declined. He did not want to be a burden on his first meeting. As her mother was kind and considerate, Elesa's father was the complete opposite. He gave Zan nothing but angry stares and rude comments.

Janet excused herself and dragged her husband with her. "What is your problem?!" she asked as they were out."

"Our daughter is friend's with a dragon freak monster and your asking ME what's wrong?!"

"Our daughter trusts him, as do I..."
111121111221122212211111.title: Complications

choices: Rage, Zan will find the man and kill him. (As a side note, he will learn fire)
Sadness, the next day Zan buries Elesa at the cliffs. Afterwards he is too sad
111121111221122212212.content:
No response came from Elesa. No sigh, no groan, not even a sigh of life. Her breathing even seemed to stop. Zan backed up against the wall. "No...no I didnt...no...no I couldn't..." he mumbled. Jade walked in and saw Zan's scared expression. She turned to Elesa and rushed to her sides. Zan stayed in the room, watching his mother check all of his love's wounds. But, to Zan's sadness, Elesa let out a heavy sigh.

"Zan..." she said.

Zan slowly walked up towards her. His wings were folded tightly against his back. "Y-Y-Yes...?" he managed to say.

"There is no easy way of saying this...Elesa...she..."

Zan pushed his mother out of the way and gently tried to listen to Elesa's heart. Nothing. Silence. Zan collapsed to his knees and tears began to form in his eyes. "M-M-Mother...d-d-did I...........?"

"Yes Zan, I'm afraid that Elesa...is dead."

Zan's tears fell from his eyes and fell onto Elesa. He didn't want anything anymore. He didn't want to eat, sleep, or even take a single foot out of the hut, the only thing he wanted was Elesa. A feeling began to build inside of him. It was...
111121111221122212212.title: She's...dead...

choices: Zan calms down but doesn't change back
Zan does not calm down and tries to attack his mother
1111211112211222122121.content:
Zan stayed there crying. Elesa, the only person in the entire world that loved him, was gone. If it wasn't for him, Elesa would be alive. No. That man. That strange man was to blame. If he never showed up, Zan would have never fallen under his spell. He would have never attacked. Elesa would have been alive. It was all because of the man. Zan thought of this and a growl escaped his lips. His eyes were slowly fading to red and his pupils started to become more like slits. Jade started to become worried about her son. She got up and placed her hand on his shoulder.

"Zan...? Are you alright...?" she asked.

What Jade did not know was that Zan was effected by the man's spell more than anyone knows. All of the evil and energy that caused Zan to transform were actually still in him. They were only dormant. Zan stood straight up, tilted his head toward the sky, and let out a feral roar. But this wasn't only a roar. A powerful stream of flames poured out of Zan's mouth and burned a hole straight through the ceiling. Jade was forced back from the sheer power of the attack as Zan's body became surrounded in a familiar shade of red. Zan began to change, but he changed even more. His body gained lots more height and muscle. Jade now only stood knee height to Zan as he continued to change. Spikes began to grow out of Zan's shoulders, arms, back, legs, and tail. His wings grew out as the also developed a blade-like edge. His teeth now grew as twice as big. Zan's claws on his feet and hands grew to ten inches as they turned to a blood red shade. Zan roared his feral roar out into the sky again, this time being louder and more deafening. Jade was scared out of her mind. Her kind, gentle son was now this 15 foot monster. His eyes were now filled with the red glow as he stood there.

"Zan...Zan!" shouted his mother. "Please calm down!"
1111211112211222122121.title: Zan's True Dark Side

11112111122112221221211.content:
Zan's red eyes landed on the small voice that he heard. His mother had a look of fear, a emotion Zan has never seen her with. Her memory restarted in Zan's mind. Zan immediately knew who she was and stopped. The red flushed out of his eyes and the glow faded. But sadly, Zan showed no sign of shrinking. Zan looked down at his body; he was scared beyond belief. He landed on the ground with a thud that shook the entire house. He curled up with his knees in his face and began to sob. Jade had no idea what to do. Her son is now taller than she is while sitting! But, this menacing looking monster was her son. She walked up beside him and gently rubbed what back she could reach. "It's okay Zan..." she said, "Everything will turn out alright..."

Zan suddenly whirled around and loomed over his mother. "Alright? ALRIGHT?! WHAT ABOUT ME IS ALRIGHT?!" he growled at her. Jade was pinned to the ground in fear. "My only chance of happiness died, a man is out to kill your husband, and he wants me to become his mindless slave! And now, I'm a huge menacing monster with no chance to return to normal. So mother, WHAT...MAKES THIS...ALRIGHT?!?!"

Smoke was flowing out of Zan's nostrils and tears were coming out of his eyes. His massive teeth were nearly a few inches away from Jade's face. Jade was paralyzed with fear as she had nowhere to go. Zan kept breathing heavily from his uproar. Jade saw his anger slowly fade from his eyes. Zan slowly raised his head, allowing Jade to get off the ground. Tears continued to flow out of Zan's eyes. "I'm sorry mom..." he said, "I just don't know what to do anymore..."

Jade walked up and placed a hand on Zan's cheek, "Whatever happens, you will always be my son." Jade wrapped her arms as far around as she could around her son. Zan returned the hug without crushing her.
11112111122112221221211.title: The Monster Inside

choices: Zan sighed and pulled his wings back togather
Zan decided to leave his home, he took off flying
1111211112211222122122.content:
Zan couldn't feel rage, too much was in his head when he attacked Elesa. Ever so slowly, Zan picked up Elesa's dead body and slowly walked out. He didn't care if the sun was out; all of his cares in the world just died at his own claws. As the sun started to set, he walked out to the spot where fell. The spot where they first met, and where for the first time another person cared for him. Zan couldn't stop crying as he dug a grave. Zan couldn't understand why this would happen to him. After everything that happened to him as a kid, why would the biggest change in his life end with someone dying.

That man had so done much too him that should have sparked rage in most people. But because of Elesa's death, he felt too guilty; knowing the fact that he know too well that he was the one who killed Elesa. Zan didn't feel anger, he felt lost. More lost than he ever has before. Zan took one last look at Elesa and her beauty. Zan sighed and start fill the hole up with dirt.

He sat there on the edge of the cliff, thinking to himself. "I never start thinking about it before, but what if I.....tried to find....a dragon clan...?

"No, no I couldn't do that" he said out loud. "......but.....what would happen?" Zan looked up at the sky, and sighed as he got up. Spreading out his wings, Zan looked at the valley, and the lights of the hut that he lived in was at the edge of the valley. Looking the other way, his gaze ventured out into the darkness. Zan closed his eyes, he then.....
1111211112211222122122.title: Why the Sadness?

11112111122112221221221.content:
No...I probably be more like a human to them anyway... Zan thought. I guess I can't be accepted by any race...

Zan's wings folded in against his body. He sighed as he walked away from the cliff's edge. He half unburied Elesa's grave, which revealed her head. He took off the necklace, the last reminder of Elesa, and placed it around her neck. The two gems glowed but Zan never noticed. He talked while he recovered her, "Elesa...I'm sorry. You don't know how guilty I feel. The necklace you gave me belongs to a caring person, not a monster." The hole was covered completely and Zan stood up. "I don't deserve to be with you anymore, even if you were still alive. Just...please don't forget me..." Zand grabbed a rock and placed it at the front of her grave. Using his claws, the very cause of her death, he wrote: "Elesa, a good friend and a kind soul. She didn't deserve to die. Have pity on her poor soul." Zan was crying as he etched that into the rock. With his final regards, Zan took off to his home to be alone. For the rest of his life.

Years have past since Elesa's death. The first few months Zan did nothing cry and waste away. But eventually Zan decided not to waste his life away. That man would come back, and Zan was going to make sure he would stay dead. Zaggar understood his motivation and helped train Zan. Zan is now 20 human years old. His body has grown even more. He stood at a height of ten feet and his body was extremely muscular. The muscles looked natural and did not make him look freaky. His wings and tail grew a good length in portion to his body. Zan now had better flying abilities and could breathe fire. Although Zan trained hard every day, he felt the solemn feeling that came with being alone. He only wished that one day, someone as good as Elesa came. One day, he was inside his hut. There was a knock on the door. Zan walked to the window and peered through. At the door was...
11112111122112221221221.title: Years Alone

111121111221122212212211.content:
Zan nearly screamed from shock. Standing in front of the door, was Elesa. But she seemed older. In fact, she was the same age as Zan. Her hair seemed longer and she seemed taller. Her face had an even greater expression of beauty. Zan was in complete shock.

H-H-How.......is th-th-this possible?! Elesa is...alive?! But...I killed her.....she should be living.

Zan was knocked out of his train of thought when he heard knocking on the door again. Slowly, Zan walked to the door and opened it. But, he only opened it a little, barely able to either of them to see the other. "Hello...?" asked Zan. His voice was now deeper. Elesa looked confused, "Oh sorry mister...I'm looking for Zan. Is he home?"

"Uh...Elesa...it's me..."

Zan opened the door entirely, revealing his aged body to Elesa. Elesa gasped as she saw him. Zan believed that she probably saw him as a monster. But, in Elesa's eyes, Zan was perfect. His muscles were well toned, capable of seeing every last detail. She blushed, but it wasn't seen by Zan. Zan sighed and closed the door behind him. Elesa stopped the door from closing and walked in, "Zan wait! I haven't seen you in years! Why did you leave? Why didnt you come back to the cliff?...why...?"

Zan turned towards Elesa. Small tears were in her eyes. "I didn't want to hurt you again..." he said. "I killed you...with my own claws...with no control. What if I do that again? What if you die? How ate you even living?!"

Zan was quickly hugged by Elesa. Although, due to the size different, Elesa was hugging Zan's waist. This made Zan blush. "Zan....I have no idea how or why" she said. "The only thing I remember is seeing nothing but darkness, but then I saw this bright flash and I woke up on the cliff. However...I saw the rock..." Zan kneeled so they could see each other, roughly face-to-face. "You were not the cause...that man was. You shouldn't blame yourself. Zan...I love you...and nothing you will do will change that." They each embraced each other in a hug, crying tears of joy.

But, the truth behind Elesa's revival was...
111121111221122212212211.title: Elesa?!?!

1111211112211222122122112.content:
A faint image of Zan and Elesa filled a small pool of water. A shadowyfigure loomed over it, watching and laughing. The room he was in was a stone room. Something that looked like part of a castle.

"This is planning out even better than I have expected..." he said as he left from the water bowl. "Ah Creo...you are a true evil mastermind. By bringing that poor child's love life, his spirit instantly regained it's glory. But thanks to my magic, not only is she alive, but she is under my control. All I have to do is wait..."

Creo finally came into the light, revealing his face. His skin was a pale white, while his hair and eyes were a blood red. Fangs appeared from his mouth, but these fangs were not long. Creo grabbed his staff and slowly twirled it in place. Red energy flowed up and formed into a heart. "Once I control Elesa long enough, I will ease up Zan's interest. Then" the heart formed a crack down the middle and sit into two, "Once Elesa breaks up with Zan, the child's heart will be too broken. Then, I will erase all memories of Zan from the girl's mind; making her scared of him, and for Zan to loose even more ofhis spirits. Then, then will be the perfect time to do it! Once he is heartbroken, I will use my spell to drain him completely. Then, his empty shell of a body will be the perfect tool for my revenge against the human race!"
1111211112211222122122112.title: Creo

Alien's chapter (Or someone else who could or couldn't create a good chapter)

111121112.title: Choice 2
