1111212.title: A lady whelpling.

111122.content: After much dicussion, Jade and Zaggar came to a conclusion. They wrapped the baby back up, and went outside. They tried to keep their burden hidden, so they would not get noticed. They climbed onto Zaggar's brown horse, and rode off. They went to the countryside, to the farthest farmhouse to the East. Jade climbed off, and walked to the entrance. She hugged her baby for the last time, and gently placed her baby on the doorstep. Jade knocked on the door, and quickly ran back onto the horse. They rode off before the owners answered the door. The door slowly opened, and there was a...
111122.title: The Helm Family

1111221.content:
A woman dressed in a working robe opened the door. She had red hair, cut short, and blue eyes. Her skin was tan as well, but had smudges of dirt on them. She looked around for someone.

"Hello?" she asked. "Who is there?"

The woman then looked down, and saw the bundle. She reached down and picked up the object. She removed the blanket cover, and her eyes widened. She smiled, and entered the house. A fireplace was lit by a fire, warming and illuminating the entire room. A small wooden rocking chair was placed in front of it. The woman sat down and began to rock. A young boy walked in, followed by an even younger boy. The two boys were around ten and five.

"Who was it Ma?" asked the older boy.

"Someone left this dear at our doorstep" she replied.

The two boys walked over, and looked at the young dragon baby. They did not looked scared, they were only confused.

"What is it?" asked the older boy.

"It's a new member of the family" replied the woman.

"Really!" said the younger boy. "Is it a boy or girl?"
1111221.title: Sheila

11112211.content:
"What should we name it?" the older boy asked.
"How about...."
11112211.title: Male

111122112.content:
"How about Draco, like stars momy?" asked young Joseph.

"That sounds wonderful, dear." Said the woman. The older brother, Daniel, just rolled his eyes.
111122112.title: Draco (named after the constellation.)

11112212.content:
"It is a young girl" said the woman.

"What is her name?" asked the older boy.
11112212.title: Female

111122122.content:
"Rose" said the woman, "Her name will be Rose."

As soon as the little baby heard her name, she opened her eyes. Her eyes were a sparkling light blue. She looked up at the woman, and smiled. The boys crowded around her, and she smiled at the rest of them as well. However, Rose fell asleep quickly, and yawned. The woman made a small bed for her, and placed her in it. The youngest boy walked up to her, and tried to climb up.

"Joseph, get down from there!" said the woman.

Joseph climbed back down, but stayed there for a little bit.

"Sleep well Rose" he said.
111122122.title: New Member

1111221222.content:
Fifteen years passed after that faithful day, and Rose grew up with Sheila and the Helm family. Rose was now a teenager. She was around 7' 7", bigger than most human teenagers, but smaller than average dragons. Her beautiful black scales shone in the light. She had a very slim body, wide hips and large breasts. Her tail has grown to about two feet long, and had large one inch long scale on the end of it. Small spikes were around her head, but they were not long. The claws on her hands and feet grew longer, but she was careful Rose walked on her toes instead of her heels like dragons. Her wings were probably her most distinct feature. Rose had a wingspan of about ten feet. The underside of her wings were a dark shade of purple. She lived happily and peacefully with her family.
---

I woke up to a usual morning. My bed was makeshifted because of my size, but it was comfortable. I got up, stretched every part of my body, and the went to the kitchen. I kept my wings folded up, so I wouldn't cause much trouble. I grabbed some of the fruit and walked out to the fields. I was about to begin my daily chores, when Joseph approached me. Joseph was the younger of the two brothers that I had. He was about five years older than me, but he was still a brother. He had short brown hair, freckles, and strange yellow eyes. He wore th usual work clothes, but those things were nearly rags.

"Rose, I need your help" he said.

"What is it?" I asked.

"Ma wants me to tear down the old barn. But I had to go into town today for some supplies. I need you to do one of these tasks."
1111221222.title: 15 years later

11112212221.content:
"I will go to the town" I replied, "What did you need?"

"Thanks!" replied Joesph. "I realised that we ran out of nails yesterday when I was about to finish the fence. And we are also short on food too."

"Nails and food...got it!"

Joseph was always like that. He seemed more carefree than his brother and he was always ready to help without hesitation. Even though he was the yonger brother, Joseph was really tall and skinny, almost as tall as me. He was usually smiling and very easy-going. He was always very kind to me and invited me to his friends' parties and worked hard. He always acted as if he didn't notice any...differences...between us...

"Don't forget to cover yourself first" reminded Daniel walking with a pile of sticks into the room.

Daniel was the oldest. He was usually gloomy and didn't talk much, but he was a nice and reliable guy. Although, he seemed a bit cold with me sometimes. I cannot blame him, ever since he had to take care of both me and Joseph when we were little. He was always the one in charge and the last to leave the fields. But this time he had a good point. The problem with human clothes is that they don't fit me. Shirts are not designed for people with wings, and neither are pants for people with tails, nor boots for digitigrade legs. I'm also pretty sure that no one has clothes for my size and my...body... I may be different, but I still see the way the local boys look at me. This is why I have to wear a special hand-sewn costume, handmade by my mother. However, it is very hot in the fields during the summer and visitors are very rare so I go around almost naked most of the time. Not that my brothers haven't seen that already...

"Fine, fine..." I said feeling a bit annoyed. Of course he meant another set of clothes that were meant to disguise me. These were far less comfortable and a real pain to wear when it was so warm. The only "upside" is that it covers my entire body without having to be seen. Daniel never wants me to be seen.
11112212221.title: Go into Town

choices: Run into a group of Imperial Soldiers (Monster Hunters)
111122122212.content:
Wearing Uncomfortable cloths

I decided to wear the think uncomfortable cloths because after all my adoptive family has risked by hiding me from the Imperial government which actively hunted monsters and I know that in their eyes I would be considered one. I walked back into the house with a sigh and gathered up the cloak I’m going to wear. In order to wear it I’ve got to fold my wings over my body which limited my arm movement but it didn’t completely stop me from using my arms. As I slip the cloak over my body I feel it press my tail down due to the cloak being made out of a thick and sturdy material. I walked out into the noonday sun where my brothers are working with the Animals and I wished them goodbye and set out for the village which was about two miles away.
111122122212.title: Take the disguising clothes

choices: Stay and listen to the Magistrate
1111221222121.content:
Road is Clear

I arrived at the village with no problem as the road was clear of any obstructions. As I entered the town I saw a group of villagers talking to two strangers. One I saw was an Imperial Magistrate due to his ornate clothing while the other was completely unknown to me. The second stranger was wrapped nearly completely in bandages that were stained from apparent years of use. His appearance was very similar to that of the legendary monster known as a mummy except he was wearing a blue sleeveless over coat that was opened. Under the coat was what looked like the lower half of a robe except that this was made of the same stained materials as the bandages but the hem was quite ragged. His head was completely bound except for a single hole revealing a storm grey eye that was shot through with red. The Magistrate seemed to be talking to the crowd while the bandage man was just standing there. You wondered what they were talking about but your brother really needed those nail.
1111221222121.title: Run into a group of Imperial Soldiers (Monster ...

choices: Rose feels someone watching her (E. Huzi is there)
Rose notices nothing (E. Huzi is still there)
11112212221211.content:
Head to the shop
I decided to head to the general store because if what the Magistrate said was important I would hear about it later. As I entered the store I saw Lawrence the portly store owner standing behind the counter checking his logs about the items he’d ordered or sold recently. As I approached he looked up with a smile on his face.
“Ah Miss Rose,” He chuckled, “It’s good to see you again.”
Lawrence was one of the few people my family trusted with my secret and he’s actually been quite helpful in keeping people away from the farm as well as keeping us informed of whenever Monster Hunters entered the village.
“It’s nice to see you too Lawrence,” I smiled.
“Now what do you need?” Lawrence inquired.
“My brother needs some nails,” I told him.
He nodded and reached under the counter where he pulled out a five pound bag of nails knowing that my brother liked to buy in bulk and this was the largest size they had.
“That will be five gold,” Lawrence told me.
I nodded and reached into the bag tied to my waist where I pulled the money from and then placed it on the counter. As I picked up the bag the bell by the door tinkled showing that someone else had just entered the shop. I turned to see the man in bandages standing there a sealed scroll in his hands which were armored in gauntlets with vicious looking claws with the bandages loosely wrapped over the entire gauntlet.
“You are shopkeeper Lawrence?” The man inquired.
“Yes,” Lawrence answered cautiously as if he knew something about the stranger that I didn’t.
“You are requested by the Magistrate to hang this decree from the Marquis in your store,” He stated without emotion.
“Fine give it here,” Lawrence snarled angrily.
I was shocked as this was the first time I’d seen him angry over something as the Marquis asking to hang something up…there had to be more to this situation than I knew. As the stranger left I turned to see Lawrence considerably paler. I walked over to see emblazoned on the paper were the words “People of Cheng Village this a warning of unusual activity in your area. Until this activity ceases or the culprits are apprehended Magistrate Eldmore and Qing warrior E. Huzi are to be stationed in your village until further notice.” I looked at Lawrence to see him staring at me the concern evident in his eyes.
“You have to leave town now,” Lawrence hissed.
What, why!?” I inquired shocked.
“That man who was just left was Qing warrior,” He whispered, “The Qing are renowned monster hunters but they normally never leave their desert homes…whatever they promised him was enough to make him forsake his clan.”
There was a desert a hundred miles east of us and I’d grown up on tales of fearsome warriors from the desert who often hunted the fearsome monsters that roamed the sands but they valued their clans beyond life itself so if this man had left his clan then he was offered something that would greatly aid his clan. I nodded and hurried out the door and began heading home.
-Somewhere nearby-
“Are you sure she’s one of them?” The Magistrate inquired.
“She is acting odd and out of place,” The Qing warrior answered, “It is nearly eighty degrees out here and she is wearing a thick dress…A normal person would be dead by now due to heat stroke.”
“If you’re wrong and he escapes again-,” The Magistrate began.
“I’ll take the blame for it,” I cut him off,” E. Huzi cut him off, “He has slain too many of my brothers and sisters for me to simply allow him to get away…and this one matches the description of the one he seeks.”
“We cannot let the man in black escape,” Eldmore whispered.
“Don’t worry…Artemis dies today,” E. Huzi snarled as Eldmore walked away.
E. Huzi looked around before he bowed his head in prayer.
“Azeri Lord of the hunt, grant me the strength to silence my prey,” He whispered, “and if I should fail give my comrades the strength to continue through the grief and guide me into the arms of my ancestors.”
As two villagers walked in front of him he disappeared to follow the strange girl.
-Rose’s perspective-
I was on the main rode making my way home storm clouds beginning to darken the sky.
11112212221211.title: Head to the General Store

choices: E. Huzi wins first battle (but dies in the process)
E. Huzi loses first battle (but survives)
111122122212112.content:
Rose notices nothing
I was in such a hurry that I didn’t bother looking around to see if anyone was following me, I had to get to my family, and warn them about the man from the desert. Oh god please let them all be home…if it’s found out what I am before I warn them they’re all dead. As I ran into the area where our well was I knew something was wrong, the animals were utterly silent and my brothers were nowhere to be seen even though they should have been tearing down the barn. I whipped around looking for them but they were gone and before I could call out I felt someone behind me. I whipped around to see a man in a black hooded cloak standing there grinning at me.
“You’ve grown into a beautiful young woman,” The man complimented me.
“Do I know you?” I inquired backing away from him.
“No you don’t,” He answered still smiling, “but I’ve known you since the day you born.”
“What are you talking about?” I questioned trying to figure out what he wanted.
“Shall I tell you a secret,” He snickered.
“Why don’t you leave me alone,” I hissed wanting him to go away.
“I’ll take that as a yes,” He laughed cruelly, “They abandoned you.”
“What the hell are you talking about?” I stated the fear welling in my chest as the rain started to fall from the clouds.
“Your birth parents threw you away,” He laughed, “They didn’t want a freak for a daughter…I mean why would any human want a beast such as you as a daughter.”
“My family is here,” I roared charging at him in a rage, “I’ll kill you for insulting my family.”
My cloak had fallen off leaving me in my everyday cloths and as I rushed him I bared my fangs and went to rake my claws across his face but he simply sidestepped and grabbed my throat lifting me into the air.
“I’ve another secret for you,” He whispered, “I’m the one who changed you into the monster you are.”
“What are you talking about,” I choked out.
“Your birth father had to be punished for killing my minions,” He continued, “So I decided to transform his first born child into one of those monsters to try and force him to destroy himself by killing you…but he threw you away…but I’ll still have my vengeance when I turn his daughter on him.”
He was laughing manically at what he said as I saw the energy well up in his hands…I closed my eyes as tears welled up in them fearing that I would never see my family again.
“Why don’t you put her down?” someone questioned by the edge of the woods.
“Who the hell are you,” The man questioned dropping me, “I’ll deal with you later girl.”
“My name is E. Huzi,” the newcomer said, “and that girl is under my protection.”
I looked up to see the man in bandages from earlier standing there with a scimitar clutched in his hand and the one eye that could be shone with righteous fury.
“So you seek to fight me?” the man in black laughed, “Then I shall end your worthless life.”
111122122212112.title: Rose notices nothing (E. Huzi is still there)

1111221222121122.content:
I was witnessing one of the most terrifying yet exciting things ever in my life. These two warriors were attacking each other with almost blinding speed yet neither of them had suffered a single wound. E. Huzi was fighting with a scimitar while the man in black was fighting an ornate sabre. They seemed evenly matched and were blurs in the pouring rain that was falling from the dark thunderheads above. I got to my feet and decided to use this time to find my family. I ran into the kitchen where I found my brothers and mother tied up together back to back.
“Rose you’re alright,” The younger brother shouted, “We were worried.”
“Yeah we were,” The elder shouted, “but we can talk about that later…like when we get the hell out of here.”
“Jeez you don’t have to be so pushy,” I sighed.
“Rose their right,” My mother sighed, “We don’t have time to talk.”
I nodded and used my claws to saw through the ropes as I heard the battle pick up outside of the house.
“What the hell is going on out there?” the older brother shouted getting up.
“A Qing mercenary is fighting the man in black out there,” I told them.
“There’s a Qing fighting out there,” my mother stated in shock, “Are they fighting to see who gets to kill us?”
“No the Qing said he was here to protect me,” I answered her question as we hurried out into the downpour.
As we took off running ignoring the fight we ran into an invisible barrier.
“Shit one of them can use magic,” My oldest brother said.
I turned back to see E. Huzi lock blades with the man in black as they fought. E. Huzi seemed to be running out of strength much faster than his opponent and I saw that he was favoring his left leg quite a bit. I knew we had nowhere to go and our fate was entirely in the hands of the warriors but I wanted to do something but knew I there was nothing I could do. E. Huzi’s attacks were becoming much slower and the man in black’s attacks was still just as savage as in the beginning. All of a suddenly the man in black knocked aside the now weakened defenses of E. Huzi and to my horror ran him through with his sword.
“You were a fool to fight me on your own,” the man in black taunted.
“A fool with a plan is still better than a genius winging it,” E. Huzi laughed, “I thought you would know that better than anyone Artemis?”
“What did you call me?” The man in black inquired the fear in his voice.
“Your name,” he answered pulling himself off of his enemy’s blade, “or have you forgotten Artemis?”
“No…you can’t be him,” Artemis stated panicking, “You can’t be him…you can’t.”
“Artemis I know you’re not a fool,” E. Huzi stated, “You know who I am and you know I’m not a fool either.”
“Evans why would you do this?” Artemis yelled, “Why did you attack me alone…you’re so much better than this.”
“You should know me better that,” E. Huzi/Evans laughed coughing up blood, “I’ve never fought someone like you alone…someone who’s taken the dark path for personal gain.”
As Evans fell back against a tree just behind him a grin on his face as his eyes closed and lightning split the sky behind us revealing the shadows of a group of people standing on our roof. I whipped around to see people in strange robes. They were all the same except for different patterns and colors on them. The robes main color was white, two of them had green hoods with opposite green sleeves, one of them had a red hood with a red line going down the back from the hood, and the last one had a blue hood a blue right sleeve and an angled blue bar stretching from his right shoulder to his left hip.
“Artemis Talon you are to be executed for crimes against both the order and humanity,” the man in blue snarled.
“Master Corbain!” Artemis shouted, “No…you can’t execute me…not when I’m so close!”
“Master Talon shall be avenged,” One of the men in green snarled.
“Yes, we shall not allow you to defile your brother’s deeds,” the second man hissed.
“Don’t you dare accuse me of defiling my brother’s name,” Artemis shouted the tears running down his cheeks, “You’re the bastards who took him from me…He should have been the one leading my families forces to victory…not me…you destroyed my families work…you used my brother and I’ll kill you all!”
“It was not we who thought of this strategy,” the man in red shouted angrily, “It was your brother’s plan…to lure you here and finish you…all in the name of redeeming his family name…so don’t you dare slander him.”
“We’ve talked enough,” Master Corbain stated, “Balo, Malo grab Master Talon and get him out of here.”
“Right sir,” The two men in green shouted leaping of the rooftop their spears still strapped to their backs.
“Master Alvarez,” Master Corbain scowled, “let us attack this fool together.”
Both Corbain and Alvarez leapt of the roof Corbain having drawn his Rapier while Alvarez drew his Crescent Blade and together they both charged Artemis with a fury that would have given a dragon pause.
“Hey dragon lady,” one of the greens called, “Get that door open now!”
I looked over to see them both carrying Evens while approaching our houses door. I ran over to and opened it and as they carried him in they motioned for us to follow them. When we were all in and they had once again secured the door they set about tending their comrade.
“Malo,” the one knew as Balo said, “You need to start healing his wounds before he bleeds out all over the tower.”
As Malo reached to peel back the bandages a clawed gauntlet shot out and gripped his wrist.
“Malo…just heal the damn wound with magic,” Evens snarled.
“Master that will only heal it a little,” Malo warned, “and I know what you’re thinking and I would advise against it.”
“I’m the master here not you and I said heal it!” Evens hissed through the pain, “We can worry about proper healing once I’ve ended my brother’s madness.”
Malo shook his head while Balo looked out the window grinning at their master’s defiance as Malo set about healing his wound with magic and I stood there in awe as I saw the wound close up. I then saw the bandages rework together as if they had never been removed. As Evens got up and adjusted his gauntlets he reached up and pulled off the bandages around his head revealing a handsome man with silver unkempt hair, storm grey eyes shot through with red and a vertical scar over his left eye. Wait did I just think of him as handsome…what is going on with me.
“Malo, Balo stay here and protect this family,” Evans stated a grin on his face, “I’ve got some family counseling to attend to.”
“Right Master,” They said in unison saluting.
I watched as Evens walked towards the door with a malicious grin on his face.
“Master, don’t forget this,” Balo said tossing Evens a longsword that had a strange rope attached to it.
Evens caught the blade and then walked out the door which caused me to run to the window. Which is when I saw something that made me wonder about who this evens really was and why he had followed me. I saw him holding his blade in a reversed grip spinning the rope which I saw had a knife like weapon attached to the end. I saw him shout something at his brother which drew Artemis’s attention and I saw his eyes widen in fear as the rope knife struck him in the throat which I then saw was attached to the hilt of the blade. He yanked on the rope which must have been enchanted as it pulled Artemis all the way to Evens who ran him through with his sword and as Artemis died I saw Evens lean forward and whisper something to his brother before the light left his eyes. Alvarez and Corbain approached Evens and he motioned them to step into the house just before he collapsed and as he did my world went dark.
(If author allows I would like to reserve this path for myself. If he disagrees please message me. If he agrees I will mark paths I will continue on in this path with my handle Masterblade. Below is just an example but it is also one I want to continue)
1111221222121122.title: E. Huzi loses first battle (but survives)

choices: Open your window and think on the roof (Masterblade)
Head into the woods where you’re sure you won’t be disturbed
11112212221211221.content:
-Evens-
I lay in a bed somewhere unknown to me…it wasn’t my bed at the academy of that I was sure. My memories of the past battle were blurry as I knew that my brother was dead by my own hand but I could not remember how exactly I did it nor could I entirely remember who I’d followed just that she…or he maybe…I’m not sure…wasn’t human.
“Evens,” a voice whispered to me in the darkness, “it’s time to get off of your ass.”
“Master Corbain, is that you?” I inquired as the darkness began to recede from my vision.
“Evens you may only be 25 years of age,” Corbain growled, “but you’re still a master and therefore my equal.”
“You’ll always be my master though,” I laughed through the pain, “after all you trained me.”
“Look we’ve bigger problems to deal with,” Corbain sighed, “such as the dragon girl.”
“Did you say dragon,” I hissed sitting up so fast the room around me spun, “…please tell me you didn’t say dragon.”
“I wish I could,” Corbain stated patting me on my bandaged shoulder, “and with your families abilities that would mean that…”
“…That I’ve bonded with her haven’t I?” I inquired, “Damn it…damn it…I should have been more careful.”
“We’ve proof not that you asked,” Corbain sighed, “When you collapsed she feinted…so somehow your link is already strong.”
I believe that this situation will require some detail on my family. I’m from the noble family Talon that has in the last decade been nearly eradicated as me and my brother were the only ones left but since I executed him I’m the last one left of my line and people in my family had strong connections to the dragon genus. Our family could form mental links with creatures of the dragon genus that were so strong that even if the pair was separated by hundreds of miles they could still communicate with each other. Other benefits were that if the human bonder could use magic (Like myself) then their magical abilities would be greatly enhanced, their physical abilities would grow as well, and their senses would also sharpen to a razors edge. Some negative effects were that the partners emotions could easily effect the other’s such as if one was severely angry then the other then the other will also seem short tempered.
“I just don’t understand,” I growled, “She’s a damned hybrid…more than that she’s one of my brothers goddamn experiments.”
“It doesn’t matter,” Corbain barked at me, “She’s your responsibility even if this situation is undesirable.”
“That’s the biggest friggen understatement of the century,” I snarled, “I’ve got too much to do to train her in the arts!”
“You’ve got no choice,” Corbain sighed, “unless you run like a coward and if you do you know the order will cast you out.”
“Please leave me alone,” I stammered trying to hold back the tears, “I-I need time to think.”
Corbain nodded and left me alone as I thought about my choices…I would not run…but I wasn’t ready to train this creature…I could barely keep Malo and Balo in line so how would I keep a dragon in line. I wasn’t going to lie…I was terrified of the creature…it could probably tear me apart without a second thought even if I defended myself with my magic. I looked around the room to see I was in a loft most likely tucked away somewhere in that old farmhouse. I got out of bed and turned to see my robes, twin launchers, my sword lain out for me, and all of the accessories. I slipped on my robes which were similar to others of the order with my design being the hood blue, both sleeves are blue, a blue line down the back of my robes, and an x across my chest stretching from my shoulders to my hips. I put my left hand into a group of leather belts that then shot up my arm where they locked themselves into place from my shoulder to my wrist. I attached my launchers to my wrists and strapped my sword to my back with the hilt turned down. As I looked around I knew I wasn’t going to run away but I needed a quiet place to think but where should I go.
(The launchers are pretty much hidden blades that can fire their blade attached to a rope that the wielder can manipulate with magic and the rope is technically infinite…for an example look up the Shaman King Character Lyserg…His dowsing pendant is very similar to the launcher)
11112212221211221.title: Switch to Evens perspective (Masterblade)

choices: Fight all out “Use Weapons, magic, and use mental link” (Masterblade)
Fight with honor “No weapons, no magic, and no use of mental link”
111122122212112211.content:
I opened my window and went out onto the roof where the sun was shining merrily as if to mock me. I’d just killed my only brother and I was apparently bonded with one of his experiments. I looked around at the battle damage from the fight with my brother and witnessed my order brothers aiding with the repair of the farm and the surrounding territory. Master Alvarez was helping the dragoness hybrid tear down the barn by using an ax to cut the timbers into more manageable pieces so Malo and Balo can stack them. Master Corbain was healing the wounds that had been afflicted on the land during the battle with my brother. An old woman was knitting something while the two brothers were tending to the animals. During this time I had formulated a plan which would involve take advantage of the hybrids dragonish pride which would not let her turn down the challenge. I leapt off of the roof landing with a thump near the old woman who looked at me for a second before returning to her work, I began approaching the dragoness who turned to look at me a look of relief on her face, and when she did pain ripped across my mind from the link I shared with her causing me to stutter step. Damn it…have I distanced myself from emotions for so long they hurt…I’ve lived with anger and hatred for so long…why the hell is she blushing…I must push these thoughts aside. As I regained my composure my order brothers approached me and questioned me for the reason of my appearance outside.
“I’m here to challenge the hybrid to a duel,” I hissed.
“Are you insulting my sister,” The younger brother accused.
“No he isn’t,” The older brother sighed, “A hybrid is a being that has been born of two parents of different races…like our sister.”
“But why do you wish to duel me?” The dragoness questioned shyly.
“You’re an experiment created by my brother,” I told her dryly, “and it’s my duty to either arrest you or if you resist to kill you.”
“Then what’s the point of the duel?” the younger brother shouted, “It seems to me that no matter what my sister dies.”
“That is not the reason,” I scowled, “If I win she comes with me regardless of her preference but if she wins she will remain here under the supervision of the order.”
“What is the name of your order?” the old women inquired getting up and approaching the group.
“We are the Order of Yggdra,” Master Corbain sighed, “We’ve been charged with maintaining order and stability throughout the world.”
“And when Artemis went mad over the death of his family about a decade ago,” Master Alvarez began, “We set about seeking a way to defeat him but were loath to eliminate one of the oldest noble families in the world…that is until we found his younger brother in the desert to the east of us five years ago.”
“There was a reason I arrived disguised as one of the Qing,” I told them, “My father’s wife died but a year after her death he fell in love with a Qing woman and soon after they met he was called away to the Imperial capital…but the Qing woman was soon found to be with child…I never saw my father so I’m not sure he ever knew that he had a bastard son with the Qing woman…but until five years ago my name was E. Huzi and I was one of the best warriors of my clan but I was found by Master Corbain who explained to me who I really was and that I had a duty to stop my brother and his plots…but I was terrified to leave my clan knowing that if I left I would never be able to return…but the clan leader came to me and told me that I was not just Qing but also a warrior of another people and that these people were also my clan so I was not technically abandoning my clan but going to help an extension of it.”
“So what does that mean?” The younger brother asked confused.
“It means that he can return to the Qing,” the older woman said, “So I guess that’s where you learned to use your unique weapon.”
“Yes Mrs.…forgive me I never learned your name,” I said with a slight bow.
“It’s Helm,” She answered, “and before you duel my daughter her name is Rose.”
“Forgive me Mrs. Helm,” I apologized, “but I must do this to attempt to atone for my brother’s sins…but as a sign of good faith I’ll allow your daughter to pick what weapons I’m allowed to use.”
“Fine then you can’t use your sword,” She hissed the blush disappearing from her face to be replaced by a defiant look.
“Fine,” I chuckled unsheathing my sword and tossing it to Balo who caught it in his hands with a worried look on his face.
“Are you sure you want to do this master?” Balo questioned, “You’re still wounded from the battle with your brother.”
“Balo don’t you dare doubt Master Evens,” Malo hissed, “He could beat her scaly ass blindfolded.”
“Malo I know I said this before,” I sighed embarrassed by my apprentice’s arrogance, “but shut your trap before I shut it for you.”
“The fight shall begin on the count of three,” Master Corbain stated.
I was debating what I should do because even though I’d lost my sword I still had my launchers, magic, and if it came down to it I could probably manipulate her through our mental connection but to use them would be dishonorable but to not use them could very well cause me to reopen my wounds…and besides if she was to become another apprentice of mine she would have to learn that in battles like this when so much was at stake honor was expendable for order and efficiency but this could very easily damage her own sense of honor and push her towards the edge like my brother.
“Three!” Corbain yelled as she rushed at me.
I needed to make my decision now.
111122122212112211.title: Open your window and think on the roof (Masterb...

choices: Rose’s Perspective: She honors the bargain (Masterblade)
1111221222121122111.content:
She was rushing at me with her claws bared and I knew that I could not face her and win in a fair fight but who said I was going to fight fair.
“Technique of the nine,” I whispered preforming the hand gestures associated with the spell, “Seal of the Wind!”
As she struck at me I seemed to vanish from sight as I moved with blinding speed as I was enhanced by the wind element…I wasn’t going to show any mercy. I reappeared to the left of her where I drove my elbow into her temple stumbling her but she still had the state of mind to lash out at me but I had already vanished only to reappear directly in front of her where I punched her so hard in the stomach she was actually lifted off the ground but before she could do anything I backpedaled a few steps to put some distance between us.
“You’re cheating,” She grunted glaring at me.
“You said no sword,” I corrected chuckling, “but you said nothing about magic or other weapons I may have on my person.”
“It doesn’t matter I’ll destroy you,” She snarled charging at me again.
“Technique of the nine,” I hissed preforming a different set of hand gestures, “Seal of the Earth!”
I felt my body begin hardening eliminating the bonuses from the wind and I knew that the new bonuses would utterly shock her and give me the edge I needed to keep in this battle. She slashed at me with here claws which skidded harmlessly of my now rock hard skin caused by the spell.
“What the-oomph,” She was cut off as I slammed my fist into her stomach and sent her flying into a nearby tree which splintered upon her impacting with it.
“Oh my god,” the younger brother cried, “He’s killed her.”
“You mustn’t interfere,” the old woman said as the older brother grabbed him, “If you do they’ll execute her.”
I stood there not approaching as I could tell from the link I shared with her that she was only slightly battered and still capable of fighting but I wasn’t going to give her time to recover her strength.
“You’ve also made the mistake of not checking me over for other weapons,” I laughed launching one my hidden blade weapons and as it flew into the dust I manipulated it so it wrapped the rope around her leg and drug her out of the cloud where I then I slammed her into the ground just in front of me where she laid twitching and breathing heavily.
“You damn bastard,” She roared springing to her feet lunging at me again her claws surrounded in a strange green aura.
“What the hell,” I roared in pain as her claws raked across my midsection bypassing the spell and doing some serious damage to my midsection.
I was stunned and completely caught off guard by the ferociousness of her attacks…I was so caught off guard that I unleashed the power sealed in the darkest parts of my soul.
“Dark Gale,” I roared feeling the power well in my extended hand and as it was released with the force of a bomb destroying the entire area in front of me as I propelled myself backwards into the side of house but the spell had a downside damaging the nerves in my hand.
“Evens,” Master Corbain snarled, “You must control yourself.”
“As you wish master,” I huffed a small malicious grin on my face…I’d just fed the dark part of my soul and it would take a little while to fade.
As the dust settled Rose stood on the other side of a twenty by thirty crater staring at me in disbelief.
“What are you?” She inquired the fear evident in her voice.
“Ark of light,” I began chanting, “Open to aid you master…Reveal yourself Nimall.”
A creature appeared in a flash of light. The creature looked like a pink furry ball with a set of shiny black eyes, and four angel like wings, and landed on my outstretched hand.
“Nimall commence healing,” I ordered as the light spread healing my wounds and repairing my clothing, “Nimall you are dismissed.”
Nimall disappeared in a flash of light leaving me standing there grinning at the shocked look on Rose’s face.
“To answer your question I’m the last member of the Talon Family,” I hissed, “I’m the last person capable of wielding the Forbidden Arts as you’re about to witness first hand.”
“What do you mean?” she shrieked at me the panic evident in her voice.
“Forbidden Technique,” I hissed preforming a completely new set of hand gestures, “Pentagram of Chains!”
When I finished the spell, chains appeared forming a Pentagram Star which then immobilized the Dragoness. I slowly approached her, the grin returning to my face as I knew that I had a distinct advantage, and I wasn’t going to waste it.
“Technique of the nine,” I shouted performing several quick hand gestures, “Seal of the Flame, Pillars of Fire!”
This spell unlike the others was not meant to enhance or hinder my foes but to launch a devastating attack against by summoning several pillars of fire to scorch the battlefield clean of the foe and this spell was doing just that as Rose was completely immobilized by the Pentagram of Chains spell she had no chance to dodge it at her current strength.
“You should just surrender,” I laughed sensing that victory was within my grasp….but something was wrong…she wasn’t getting weaker…she was getting stronger, “What is happening…her power shouldn’t be increasing this rapidly.”
I forced my pillars of fire to converge into a massive rotating column of flame but she still wasn’t weakening and then her claws appeared outside the flame shredding it to pieces along with the Pentagram Star. She glowed with a cruel green light that I’d only seen once before when I met a dragon before.
“Evens her dragon blood is awakening,” Corbain warned.
“I-I-I know,” I hissed terrified by this turn of events, “But what do I do?”
“Grrr,” She growled the animalistic side of her mind taking over, “Rwarrrrr!”
She charged me and I knew that I couldn’t take a direct attack from her when she was in this state and so I needed to buy myself time.
“Chains of Binding,” I shouted as many thick chains appeared out of portals only to wrap themselves around Rose in an attempt to buy me much needed time but to hold the spell I couldn’t move.
I needed to figure out how to halt her rampage with as little collateral damage as possible but the question was how…I had several spells that could immobilize her but the ranged ones she could probably deflect while the melee range ones would put me in the very dangerous position of being in her preferred attack range which would not be a good idea. I could feel the spell quickly weakening from her own instinctual counter spells and I knew I needed to think more quickly. Wait…Maybe I can use the bond we share to immobilize her for a few seconds…she probably doesn’t even know it exists…I even know what attack I’ll use. I released the spell giving me a split second to activate my next spell.
“Technique of the nine,” I shouted preforming the hand gestures, “Seal of Lightning”
She broke the chains and rushed at me hand back to rake me with her claws and I knew I only had one chance for this so when she was only a couple of paces from me I launched my mental barrage but it was a couple of seconds too late and her attack connected raking across my chest but the pain dulled the attack tearing my skin but not my robes. She doubled over from the pain I began wracking her mind with and I struck out with my electrified fists in an attempt to disrupt her nervous system and cause her to pass out. I struck her in the stomach in the hopes of stunning, then I moved to her right side where I drove my fingers into her temple in an attempt to shock her brain, and finally I moved behind her placing my hand on her spine while at the same time unleashing wave after wave of electrical energy. As I watched her eyes dimmed and eventually closed as she passed into unconsciousness and hit the ground with a slight cloud of dust. I stood there covered in dirt and blood but I stood there grinning knowing that if she could control that power she would be an extremely valuable asset for the order.
“Rose!” the younger brother screamed as he, the older brother, and the old woman ran towards her, “What did you do to her!?”
“I put down what could have easily become a rampaging beast,” I hissed turning and walking away, “but I expect her to honor her bargain with me…She is to report to the village in three days…and don’t worry the worst that will happen when she wakes up is she’ll probably be unable to talk properly for a while.”
I turned and walked away from them leaving the farm behind but followed closely by my order brothers.
“You should get your wounds examined,” Alvarez said.
“I know but I’ll wait until where back at the village,” I huffed feeling the blood beginning to trickle from my wound.
Rose had caught me with that last attack and though it couldn’t be seen I would need medical treatment before we left the village and then there were the consequences of using Dark Gale which damaged the nerves in my hand so I couldn’t use it well and that would need magical treatment.
“Are you sure she’ll honor the deal?” Balo asked.
“I don’t know but I’ll worry about that when we get to it,” I sighed wishing I was in a soft bed right now, “Wow I’m tired…”
I blacked out as soon as I finished that…maybe my wounds were more severe than I thought.

choices: Empty with shouting and cheering coming from the square (Masterblade)
Everything’s normal and Evens awaits you at the inn
11112212221211221111.content:
-Rose’s perspective-
“Where am I?” I wondered out loud walking through the darkness.
“Why you’re wherever you want to be,” a voice laughed, “Your fate has yet to be decided.”
I whipped around to see someone in robes similar to Evens except the belts were on the other arm, the main color was black, and the secondary color was blood red with the same pattern as Evens.
“Who are you?” I asked slightly afraid of this man.
“Who I am is of no importance,” He chuckled his voice gentle and kind, “But the real question is who are you?”
“What is that supposed to mean?” I inquired curious about this person.
“On the outside you’re a dragoness,” He told me, “But what are you on the inside…who are you truly.”
“What do you mean?” I asked him drawn in by his words.
“Are you a warrior, a magus, or maybe even a princess,” He chortled, “Your past is unknown and therefore your future is unknowable to even the greatest of sages…Don’t let them whisper their venomous words to you as they did to me.”
“Who are you!?” I yelled as he began vanishing, “What do you mean venomous words!?”
“I’m the last bit of light drowning in darkness and madness,” he sighed, “and as for the words they told me I was invincible, that nothing could defeat me, and they were wrong…from these words the seeds of madness were sown and they have since grown into a massive forest…you must find out who you are if you are to defend him.”
“Wait!” I yelled as I began rushing upwards out of the darkness.
-A room in the Helm farmhouse one day after the duel-
“Mother she’s waking up,” my oldest brother shouted.
I heard the clacking of my mother’s boots on the wooden floorboards of the farmhouse.
“Rose how are you doing?” my mother inquired.
“Ugh…murgle…slurrf,” I muttered incoherently.
“What did she say?” I heard my youngest brother asked.
“I don’t know,” My mother sighed, “He told us that she may be muttering gibberish for a while after what he did.”
What do they mean I’m talking gibberish…who are they talking about…wait could it be Evens who did this to me.
“We have to find a way to talk to her!” My oldest brother shouted, “Can she even understand us.”
“Yes she can,” My mother chuckled when I nodded, “Look we need to know if you’re going to honor your bargain?”
“Of course she isn’t,” My youngest brother hissed, “They’ll lock her up somewhere or…I don’t know what but it will be bad.”
“Where do you expect her to go?” my oldest brother sighed, “They’ll hunt her to the ends of the earth and to hide from them she’ll have to live on the run in the shadows…and she deserves better than that.”
“We’re arguing for nothing it’s her decision…get me that pad of paper, a quill, and some ink,” my mother instructed knowing that I could both read and write.
“Here you go mother,” my youngest brother said handing my mother the items who in turn handed them to me.
“Now Rose we need to know what you’re going to do,” my mother told me.
“I’m not going to run,” I wrote down on the paper, “I made a deal with Evens…and I plan on honoring it.”
“You can’t do this Rose,” my youngest brother cried, “You don’t know what they’ll do to you!
“I don’t care!” I wrote angrily, “I made a promise to him and I’m going to keep it.”
“It’s her life brother no one else’s,” My oldest brother stated calmly, “In fact I would have been quite disappointed in her if she ran.”
“But what if they kill her?” My youngest brother inquired angrily, “How do we trust them.”
“This is my decision,” writing hastily, “I’ll decide what I do with my life not you!”
“Sis I’m just worried about you,” my youngest brother told me the tears beginning to flow, “I just don’t want to see you get hurt.”
“There is a war coming brother,” I told him what I believed, “and we must all pick a side and I’ve chosen mine.”
“What does she mean?” my oldest brother asked confused.
“The Order has not appeared publicly for forty years,” our mother told us, “and now they emerge a decade after the purge, girded for war.”
“Do you mean that there’s going to be a war?” my youngest brother asked scared.
“Yes as there was forty when the first schism in The Order occurred,” mother explained, “Then the second schism occurred only a decade ago and resulted in the revival of the Scions of the Tenth Seal…They practice the Forbidden Technique of the nine…also known as the Tenth Seal.”
“Wait I thought there was only nine techniques not ten,” my youngest brother said.
“There used to be ten until during the first schism the first traitor corrupted the tenth technique that was originally known as Technique of the Ten…Seal of knowledge but it was tainted into Tainted Technique of the Ten…Seal of Madness,” she explained, “This has set the world hurtling towards chaos with no hope of saving it…only slowing its demise.”
“What do you mean…is our world in danger?” My eldest brother asked confused.
“It is always in danger but with the corruption of the tenth seal people have succumbed to madness,” my mother answered, “and if no one opposes them then they will destroy everything.”
“Which is why I’m going to join the order,” I croaked my throat dry from disuse, “They need people to stand against the chaos…and I feel that the people from the order are the best to oppose them.”
My family was silent the looks telling much as both of my brothers looked worried while my mother looked proud. I knew that I would need to soon meet Evens and that meant I would have to be prepared for whatever he had waiting…but the question was when.
“I’m afraid we don’t have much time Rose,” My mother told me, “You’re supposed to meet Evens in the town today in disguise.”
“I guess I should hurry then,” I said getting up and moving to my closet.
“You’re not even going to wait are you?” my mother questioned smiling.
“The longer I wait the more dangerous the world will become,” I told her as I pulled out a pack and began putting spare cloths and the necessary items to repair it.
“But-,” my youngest brother began.
“It’s her choice and we can’t stop her…she’s nearly a grown woman now,” my eldest brother sighed, “It’s time she made her own mark on this world.”
My eldest brother then walked out dragging my other brother out with him I couldn’t help but my mother stood there grinning as she walked towards the wall where much to my surprise a secret compartment opened reveling a splendid robe that seemed to be made of black satin embossed with a pattern of rings along the hem of the robe and the ends of the sleeves. It was beautifully made and as my mother handed it to me I realized that the material was not satin but seemed to be a metal that had been sown into a set of robes.
“These robes were left for you by a man named Morvain Talon,” my mother told me, “That man was Evens father and he told me that you had a touch of destiny about you…and that you would become one of the shapers of this world…whether for better or worse.”
“Evens father met me?” I asked not remembering, “When was this?”
“I was fifteen years ago,” she laughed, “He knew you were here right away and he gave you these robes.”
“I wish I could thank him,” I sighed knowing he was dead.
“You’re to meet Evens in town so hurry and disguise yourself…you can put on the robes when you’re taken into the care of the order,” my mother told me sealing my pack with my robe and other attire in it, “He won’t wait all day before he marches out here and rips you from this house.”
I nodded and once again equipped the uncomfortably thick robes accepting that I would have to hide for a little while until Evens was present because I knew that I was still an outcast but somehow I knew he would protect me. As I finished and began walking to the door I bade my family goodbye and set off down the road to the town knowing that this was the first steps in a grand adventure. When I reached the town I saw that the streets were…

1112.content:
The father to be is excited that today his wife will give birth to their child. He stayed in his hut outside of the room, pacing. He wonders what the child would look like. Would it be a boy or girl? How would it behave? The door opened with the man's wife walking out. In her arms was a large bundle. The man was too excited and grabbed the bundle. He removed the covers slowly to cherish the moment he had. But what he didn't see was his wife crying. The man removed the last cover and gasped. He had a beautiful baby girl. Her hair was already pretty long and it was a wonderful shade of brown. But, the father was more concerned about her body. A snake tail replaced where the girl's legs should be. The scales covering the tail were a blue hue. The man looked at his wife, who'd tears were completely hidden.

"Linda dear..." he said, "What has happened to my daughter...?"

The reason the mother gave birth to a Naga is...
1112.title: Naga

choices: They head to the Naga's homeland
11121.content:
The new mother, Linda, began to tear up as she saw her husband fret over their child. She had something on her mind that wanted to come out. Linda finally faced her love. "Drew..." she said faintly, "This is the reason that I gave birth to a Naga." A light emitted from her body as it became brighter. Drew had to shield his eyes but he could see what was happening. Linda's legs soon joined together and a long tail came from the light. Her scales took on a green shade. The new father is shocked that his wife is actually not human, quite a bit for him to process.

"I understand if you don't want me..." said the mother. Her original eyes are now showing; yellow irises with black slited pupils. "I will leave you with my child to avoid any conflict..." With a heavy heart, Linda began to slither towards the door to their home. They built this house by hand together.

"No, Linda wait!" said the husband. This caused Libda to stop and turn. "Its not that i dont love you, I'm just shocked. I still love you, but why did you disguise yourself? Can't you trust me?"

The Naga mother is now very happy that her husband still loves her. She took in a breath, calmed herself, and told her tale. "My race, the nagas, are slowly dying out. We only have females in our clan now. The only way for us to continue the safety of our species is to mate with others. The other two involve love..." Tears began to form on the ridges of her eyes. "When I met you, I instantly knew I loved you. But I was afraid you would run if you saw the real me. I wanted you to love me...I'm sorry..."

"Ots okay dear, I'm just trying to take it all in" said Drew, "But do you really love me."

"Of course I do" said the Naga wife, "I did not want to force anyone to mate with me, I wanted someone to love me for who I am inside."

This comforted the new father. But now the the couple needs to figure out what the future holds for them with the child.

Her height was six feet ten inches, taller than her father, with a tail length of about fifteen feet. Her brown hair hung just below her body's midsection between snake and girl. The blue scales covering her tail shone in the light full and healthy. Her eyes were naga in appearance, but they were green instead of yellow. Her human top's skin was deeply tanned. As part reptile, Vivian loved being in the sun. Her mother taught her how to hunt in her form and all of the abilities a naga has. Her father taught her human manners and behavior. Vivian had the behavior of a naga and a human. She always wore a fabric shirt that barely covered her massive cleavage. Yes, I said it. Nagas generally don't wear clothes, so Vivian felt weird. But the fabric at least kept her out of the nude. She took regulary trips to the forest to explore and collect wild flowers. One day, she met someone else in the forest...
1112122.title: Teenage Naga

11131.content:
A pleasent sea-side town across a plain is shown. The sun is set high in the sky, and slightly covered by a few clouds. A large ocean was on the West side of the town. A few small hills were on the outskirts of the town. The small town was mostly constructed of wood. A man was walking out of town towards the docks. He was a tall and skinny man. He had black hair, pale skin, and brown eyes. He wore long boots, wore a red long-sleeved shirt, and carried a net full of fish. He just left town, and headed to the docks. A small wooden house was set near the docks. It was small, but looked comfortable. The man had a smile on his face the entire way. Before he entered the house, the man placed the net full of fish in a barrel. He walked in, and immediately saw a woman. She was shorter than him, had similar black hair, blue eyes, and freckles. She wore tan clothing that looked similar to animal hide. She had a worried look on her face, but she seemed happy. The woman walked up to the man, and hugged him.

"Honey..." the woman said, "Your..."

"I know my dear Linda" the man said. "I'm sorry I missed the birth of my child. But, I will make it up. I will care for the child even more than I ever had to anyone. Except, for you."

"That's fine Darwin" said Linda. "But, there is something you should know about the child."

"What, is everything alright?"

Linda walked away and came back with a bundle of clothes in her arms. She had a warming smile on her face, but it tunred to concern when she handed Darwin the baby. Darwin grabbed the baby, looked at it, and stared at it. The baby he was holding was shaped like a human, but wasn't exactly human. It was covered in green scales, from head to toe. Its hands and feet were webbed, and had small claws. On its head, were two large fins that started on the sides. It slightly looked like hair, but there was none. Darwin stilled looked surprised, but he smiled.

"I...have a...child" he said.

"You are not offended by what it looks like?" asked Linda.

"This is my child, and I will love it. It may not look human, but it is no beast."

"That's what I wanted to hear."

They kissed each other, then looked at the baby. It was a...
